      public GlyphMap​(int capacity)

      Parameters:
      capacity - how many glyphs this should be able to hold at the start, before resizing

  • Method Details

    • fuse

      public static int fuse​(int x, int y)
      Combines the up-to-15-bit non-negative ints x and y into one non-negative result int. This is used to get the keys for a GlyphMap given x,y inputs. Because jdkgdxds uses Fibonacci hashing to scramble keys, there's no concern here from leaving all of x in the lower half of the bits and all of y in the upper half.
      Parameters:
      x - an up-to-15-bit non-negative int (between 0 and 32767, inclusive)
      y - an up-to-15-bit non-negative int (between 0 and 32767, inclusive)
      Returns:
      a non-negative int that combines x and y into one value

    • extractX

      public static int extractX​(int fused)
      Given a fused x,y pair as an int (typically produced by fuse(int, int)), this gets the x component from it, as an int.
      Parameters:
      fused - a fused x,y pair as an int as produced by fuse(int, int)
      Returns:
      the x component of fused

    • extractY

      public static int extractY​(int fused)
      Given a fused x,y pair as an int (typically produced by fuse(int, int)), this gets the y component from it, as an int.
      Parameters:
      fused - a fused x,y pair as an int as produced by fuse(int, int)
      Returns:
      the y component of fused
